author: carlhenryglobal
title: Sustainable forestry Hub Cambodia
description: We need to build sustainable Cardano Community Hubs around viable local projects, deforestation is a worldwide problem.

f6_assessments.q0:
At first I thought “I don’t know that this would impact Cardano directly,” however then I realized that A. this would provide good PR and marketing for Cardano, showing a positive impact on the globe, which B. is directly in line with the Challenge/Campaign Brief of “making the world a better place” and that “when the challenge succeeds, the beneficiary is the whole Cardano community.” As the proposer wrote, “Leading by example in the Asia regions we will encourage the growth in the number of Cardano Community Hubs” shows that there should be great Impact. 

Given that there is another Fund8 Challenge for “Lobbying for Favorable Legislation” has me slightly wondering why there was an emphasis in this Proposal of the government’s land operation approvals as the intended audience, but with the emphasis seeming to also be on the community and environment, it makes sense why this Proposal was placed here. 

I find it fascinating how this Proposal sets forth a FTN note/token (NFT) to render the environmental and social impacts of this project to even yield financial growth, too, covering both Return-on-Intention and literal Return-on-Investment ROIs. 

I further like the explanation of how this project, if successfully implemented, will increase East Asian participation in Cardano, in Catalyst, in Stake-Pool Operators (SPOs) and stake pools, and provide insight into future ways to continue to grow Cardano as a whole. 

This project most definitely will have a considerable positive impact on not just the local community but the environment as well, however measuring by numbers of Proposals from East Asia, increased participation in Catalyst, wallet activity, etc. from the Campaign Brief may not be immediate, but instead more middle- or long-term.
f6_assessments.q1:
On the SURFACE, at first glance, the Feasibility section of this Proposal alone looks rather bare and in some ways a copy-paste of the Challenge/Campaign Brief, however when one follows the link to http://florestaproject.com/team there is considerably more evidence that the team proposed is already in action participating in similar projects in the region (Cambodia). Further, the embedded 2-minute-30-second YouTube link shows evidence of the team already building the teak farms/tree farms that they set out to make. This, to me, suggests that it is not just feasible, but that funding would further expand and boost a project that’s already in-action, thus that funding would add to their momentum. Their amazing FlorestaProject.com website shows partnerships with several organizations/”Supporters” that could likely also help make this project a reality. 

However, there is somewhat of a “circular” problem in that the Feasibility section of the Proposal claims that visualization of a budget breakdown can be found by following a link to a Gerolamo.org website, which is rather bare and empty and merely links right back to Catalyst IdeaScale proposals, without a clear way to see the supposed "more information" funding breakdown. It is for this reason that I cannot rate this Proposal higher on Feasibility: without being able to clearly see the budget breakdown, it is difficult to imagine or envision just how exactly the funds would realistically be put into action.
f6_assessments.q2:
While I am sure that there is some way to follow along the Cardano Community Hubs and measuring CO2 reduction and reforestation, I struggle to find clearly-measurable and easily-measurable numbers as KPIs for this project. It references being a continuation and expansion upon F7: Scale-UP Community Hubs, but again, I don’t see an easy way to count/measure. Aside from the monitoring of numbers minted and sales or transfers of their Floresta Tree Note (FTN) tokens, or perhaps regular updates provided by the team on acreage/hectares planted of their teak tree farms, I am not quite sure how anyone would measure the success of this project’s funding. 

I would have liked to have seen a more clear, explicit mention of exact, quantified ways to measure the progress of this project, but details written in the Proposal seem quite vague and nebulous and hard to count.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal give comprehensive information on how they will build a Cardano hub to facilitate reforestation. The Floresta project is also an ongoing project with its informative website and well-documented ongoing progress. The team elaborates clearly what are the potential risks that may hinder project progress. However, the proposal did not specify how each of those risks will be overcome. I also notice they mention they are in coordination with [https://gerolamo.org/](https://gerolamo.org/), but the hyperlink cannot be accessed and give 503 services unavailable.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal gave a complete list of each member who contributed to the project, LinkedIn profiles, and hyperlinks to the Floresta website for further information regarding the team. However, when I try to open https://gerolamo.org/our-projects/fund-8-proposals-and-data
 for the budget breakdown I get a 503 service unavailable. Furthermore, the proposal does not provide any details on how and what steps are necessary to get a cardano hub that can support facilitate reforestation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal state the objective is to attract and onboard people to create Cardano Community Hubs in Asia. However, the proposal did not specify a number and thus cannot be measured. It will be much better to have a measurable target, for example, conducting weekly meeting zoom, creating two workshops each month, or having more than 40 active participants weekly.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer describe a problem that might suit for a Campaign Challenge rather to be a single proposal to solve a problem? It is not clear what the proposer wants to do or aim to do with this proposal and which solution is offered. Is it a collaboration with the 2 website mentioned? how? what is the connection between the proposer and the websites.

The mitigation plan also somehow not correlated with what the proposer aim or trying to articulate in this proposal? why creating an NFT to mitigate the risk, and why the Catalyst team is involved?
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer, unfortunately, did not share any timeline or roadmaps to implement this project successfully. The budget mentioned available on the website link also cannot be accessed (I would suggest putting all attachment / supporting data within the Ideascale to avoid errors or dispute). 

With both supporting data unavailable, as a CA it is hard to assess if the team is mentioned are directly connected with the proposer or other? as I cannot check or see what is the correlation between the proposer and the Floresta team? How is Cardano Hub going to help the Floresta project? I would suggest the proposer share more details and project goals
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer seems to mention a broader target - that may fit a Campaign Challenge rather than a single project and misunderstood the Campaign Challenge. There is no measurable KPI target that we can assess in this proposal - or what milestone that this project wants to achive?

I would suggest the proposer re-work this proposal and work with the Catalyst School or EHT team before submitting this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
I have read this proposal in detail and I can see that the team of proposers need funding to help them set up a Cardano hub purposely to facilitate reforestation and responsible logging  in their communities in Cambodia. This is a laudable project to help sustain the environment for the future generation. 
Addressing the challenge, the team will introduce the benefits of a Cardano community hub to the forest ecosystem of the project. They will create a Cardano community hub within the local communities to support the larger project. Again, the impact is to enhance the position of stakeholders in Cambodia to improve their engagement and living standards. KPIs here include increased demand for Teak wood resulting in financial sustainability, increase in profitability, financial stability and the restoration of the natural ecosystem. 
The most vital point is increasing participation of Asian residents in Cardano community and catalyst teams, increasing the stake pools and SP operators. 
The main risk is possible attacks from unfavorable legislation from government.  With this laudable write up, the challenge is effectively addressed by the proposer. My rating is 4
f6_assessments.q1:
The detailed plan for delivering the solution are the number of proposals originating from East Asia participants inproject catalyst, the quantity and quality of funded proposals originating from East Asia teams. 
The budget breakdown is detailed and was provided by the links to get them. 
The team is made up of 9 persons with varied experiences like strategic Advisor, on-site Agronomist, etc. who are capable of successfully implementing the project. . The details of information here are sufficient for the successful implementation of the proposal. My rating is 4.
f6_assessments.q2:
We can measure performance by looking at the numbers of Cardano community hubs financed by viable and profitable projects and business activities. 
Success can be measured by looking at the achievement of a sustainable practice of CO2mitigation and reforestation with sustainable logging. Sustainable forestry in Cambodia will be seen in the financial innovation of Floresta Tree Note 'making money for doing good'. 
The proposal is a continuation of a Fund7 funded proposal - Scale Up Cardano Hubs - Cardano Worldwide Community. 
In my opinion the information provided here is sufficient for the successful auditing of this proposal.  I recommend that the proposers will seek for a few more experts in forestry conservation to help them deliver an excellent project, which on the whole will help solve some climate change problems. Good proposal. My rating is 4.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of combining the Cardano Center and forestry development is a good one. Cardano will be famous, widely known for its humanity, contribution to the development of society and environment in Asia. Very meaningful activity.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no specific plan and work items that the project wants to perform. Therefore, it is not possible to specifically envision the work the project wants to do and the work done at this fund corresponding to the proposed budget is what job.
There is no expected completion time, specific goals.
There is a link to the budget file attached, but accessing the budget does not show the budget table, only the multilingual Cardano website. Therefore, it is not possible to check the details of the proposed budget.
The project team listed the name and title but did not list detailed information about experience and skills in the proposal. Only 2 members have the Linkedin links. Attached is a link to the website of the forestry website and information about the members' experience. The members have a lot of experience and professional knowledge, however, because it is not clear what work items the project will perform in fund 8, it is not possible to assess the suitability of experience and skills to the job in charge of the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is no specific KPI/measurement for work items, nor for measuring the expected outcome of the project. Proponents should specify how the community can track progress and evaluate actual and expected outcomes.
The proponent should clearly state the expected implementation schedule and the work to be done, and the expected completion time. Catalyst and the community will evaluate progress and effectiveness based on this information.

solution: To incorporate Cardano into this sustainable forestry project & build a Cardano Hub to facilitate reforestation & responsible logging
experience: The team is essential for the success of any project, the Floresta project is no exception. Indeed, a strong, multidisciplinary, and very experienced team is the foundation of our initiative, gathering renowned experts, business men, as well as forestry and financial specialists.
